urls.title: Flooding
urls.description: LATEST INFORMATION ON FLOODING IN MALTON, NORTON AND OLD MALTON Information updated 10:00, 30 January 2021 A flood warning remains in place for the River Derwent at Old Malton. The Environment Agency has now removed the flood alerts for Mill Beck at Welham Road, Norton and the River Derwent at No

text: Flood water update: The overall position in Malton, Norton and Old Malton remains stable and is gradually improving, but response agencies remain on the ground and will continue to monitor the situation carefully. Update at https://t.co/FfBtmx2340 Flood updates: @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/dY84tdUbbD

urls.title: Guardian coverage of flood defences
urls.description: Today The Guardian has reported on the condition of flood defences across England, stating that thousands of people and businesses are â€˜at risk from ruined assetsâ€™. However, the article did not recognise that when defences are listed as below the required condition it does not necessarily mean that they have structurally failed, or that performance in a flood is compromised.

text:
RT @FyldeBeachCare: Have you spotted microplastics on the beach this weekend? 

If so please let us know the location and share any pictureâ€¦

What a brazen liar! I don't suppose any of these embarrassing brown circles coincide with chalk streams!
Pics from @theriverstrust  and @EnvAgency! https://t.co/rO0ckfv0LE https://t.co/H4Bo6zQQFY
RT @rsevern7: Unloading after over a week on the road battling the rain and snow. @SonTekYSI M9 & @ARCboat have collected some record dataâ€¦
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency So obviously people can do it without the interference of the EA. We could save the money and shut them down.

Our river keeper does more for the Kennet on his own than the @EnvAgency. Itâ€™s criminal that EA allows @thameswater to dump sewage into the ecosystem 4,628 times and @JamesBevanEA to deny it is happening. Bevan might as well be paid by Thames Water, not the public purse https://t.co/GBq7zwG73b

RT @FyldeBeachCare: Have you spotted microplastics on the beach this weekend?

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Absolutely not! Agriculture and environment are intrinsically linked - Britain is a farmed environment and has been for centuries and in some areas millennia. We need both, the one cannot survive without the other.
RT @OliverHarmarEA: From this drone pic, you really get a sense of the huge volume of floodwater weâ€™re dealing with at #Malton, thanks to eâ€¦

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Sorry was going...... so the land will become a nature park of woodland and bogs, and some grazing. Whilst the UK flys in food from around the world........?

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency I'm really happy to share some of the info with you, thank you for letting me. There are great organisations doing great work on this (check out @theriverstrust and specifically @severnrivers for more knowledgeable info). It's something where all of us need to work together ðŸ™‚

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Iâ€™m dipping out of this discussion now, cos I have to go,
Lovely chatting with you. Does Olly want compensation?

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Those of us with land high up catchment need to increase water storage to slow it running off to ameliorate effects lower down. Tree planting, allowing rivers to meander to reduce water speed etc...
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency If we slow the flow of rivers then less sediment is eroded and if more farmers are able to adopt low till techniques such as Olly and others are already doing, the less topsoil is washed into water courses. The catchment approach means everyone along it is responsible for it...

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Compensation cannot always be the answer, and I have deliberately not used farmers as part of the discussion all they want to do is provide food for the nation, they only want to make a living and they would not by choice do that by receiving compensation. We should ask a farmer!
RT @PJennings88: If the the @EnvAgency CEO @JamesBevanEA is not aware that sewage is discharged into chalk streams what chance have we got.â€¦
RT @aviationcomment: I worked with the @envagency over 20 years ago. We had the same handwringing over flood funding. Great promises, superâ€¦
Amazing work @EnvAgency ðŸ™Œ https://t.co/M1bsy6DbvU
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Yes I think part of the problem is humans thought we could impose our will on nature but today's farmers (and home owners!) are paying the very high price for that hubris. Farmers need to be compensated for having to store floodwaters and we need to explain the policy better.
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦

@blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Okay, but that sediment would be washed with the better flowing water. I still think we are interfering with nature and we need to live with nature. Thank you for sharing some of the science. Perhaps I still live on a flat earth but I do know water flows down hill. #Thanksfortime
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency ..it's about how it moves. Hydraulic radius as well as things to do with sediments, velocity, flow. It's also about how groundwater moves (below the surface). Hydraulic gradient, hydraulic conductivity and water table. Its just not as simple as it might sound.

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency ..water flows in a helical (corkscrew) pattern and flows faster in the outer beds (erosion) and slower on the opposite side (deposition). Erosion creates yet more sediment = more problems. It's far too complex a subject to explain in tweets, water doesn't just move from A to B..

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency are utterly unfit for purpose.
The name is a misnomer and @JamesBevanEA has been proved to be a liar. He could resign but these leaders failing and lieing just do not do the honourable thing these days. https://t.co/72eZd15i6S

text: @blacksheepfibre @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency Isnâ€™t that what time has always done? Are we trying to change the world too much, allow nature to be nature.

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency If you "get it away" then you increase the speed of water flow. This in turn affects the character flow of the water if you like. Slow flowing water is laminar (straight lines), fast flowing turbulent (eddies). The latter erodes river banks more rapidly, in a meandering river...
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: Appearing before the Public Accounts Committee on 14th Jan 2021 Sir James Bevan CEO of the @EnvAgency said "Almost byâ€¦

@janeweston6 @agricontract @Farmer_Tom_UK @EnvAgency The problems around rivers lie upwards of 150 years ago though. Canalisation of rivers for industrial purposes, weirs, dams, draining of wetlands, building on floodplains ... current policy is aiming to undo something literally no one has living memory of.

Alongside our ambition to plant up to 2 million trees within the River Aire catchment, @EnvAgencyYNE and @NT_TheNorth have been working with landowners near Malham to deliver natural flood management as part of Leeds FAS (1/2)
